answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
Thanks for sharing! Also note the successful Kickstarter funding. Have you seen any attempts to use crowd funding & social media to fuel experiments in city government? Kickstarter for a public art project, police dog, or citizen engagement effort? Some participation could come from engaged locals, but others nationally might support a good cause.

answers.author: David Rauch
answers.text:
I just want to say that after I read this suggestion, I reached out to the SparkTruck folks, and with less than 3 weeks lead time, we brought them to Downers Grove for more than 70 kids. It was great program, and those SparkTruckers are something special. Thanks Robert!
If anyone wants help bringing them to their community, reach out. I talked to a few other smaller communities (we are 50,000), and they had great advice.

author: Robert Carty
text:
I came across this little start-up in the blogosphere: http://sparktruck.org/
"SparkTruck is an educational build-mobile! We’re traveling across the USA with cool 21st-century shop tools, spreading the fun of hands-on learning and encouraging kids to find their inner maker."
Something to share with your education/school contacts!
Video introductions:
http://youtu.be/DSmcES4Dyik
http://youtu.be/BwLHUYxnxTA
title: Cool resource for education... or something more?
